summary: The Generating Resilient, Environmentally Exceptional National Streets Act (GREEN Streets Act) amends Title 23 and Title 49 of the United States Code to prioritize environmental considerations and improve transit accessibility in transportation planning. Key provisions include requiring the consideration of greenhouse gas emission reduction and per capita vehicle miles traveled reduction in transportation projects. It also mandates analysis of road capacity expansion projects, establishes performance goals for public roads, and sets national standards for transit accessibility, including transit accessibility, stop distance, mode share, and first/last mile accessibility.
